description: A 6-day solo, budget-friendly itinerary to Vietnam focused on key cultural, historical, and unique local experiences in Hanoi, Ninh Binh, and Hoi An, using local transportation and budget accommodation. Suits a $1000 total budget for solo travel. Prioritizes affordable food, intercity transport options, and iconic sites with many free/low-cost activities.

activities: Arrive in Hanoi. Explore the Old Quarter. Visit Hoan Kiem Lake. Enjoy local street food and check into a budget hostel.
itinerary.transportation: Local bus/grab from airport to Hanoi Old Quarter.
itinerary.notes: Stick to local eateries for budget meals.

activities: Morning street food breakfast. Visit Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum and Temple of Literature. Walk around French Quarter. Evening sleeper bus or train to Ninh Binh.
itinerary.transportation: Sleeper bus/train from Hanoi to Ninh Binh.
itinerary.notes: Use Grab app for affordable local rides.

activities: Arrive in Ninh Binh. Take a Tam Coc boat tour. Bike around countryside. Visit Bai Dinh Pagoda. Overnight in Ninh Binh.
itinerary.notes: Book buses/trains/flights ahead for best rates.

activities: Morning transfer to Hoi An (bus/train/flight via Da Nang). Explore Ancient Town’s lantern streets. Sample local cuisine: cao lau noodles. Enjoy a spa session. Bike to An Bang Beach if time permits. Overnight in Hoi An.
itinerary.transportation: Intercity bus/train/flight from Ninh Binh to Hoi An (via Da Nang); bike rental in Hoi An.
itinerary.notes: Carry cash (Vietnamese Dong) for small purchases. Hoi An is great for affordable spa experiences.

activities: Take a cooking class or get clothes tailored in the morning. Explore markets. Afternoon or evening transfer back to Hanoi (flight/bus/train). Last-minute shopping in Old Quarter. Overnight in Hanoi.
itinerary.transportation: Bus/train/flight from Hoi An (via Da Nang) to Hanoi.
itinerary.notes: Most attractions have nominal entry fees.

activities: Final stroll or coffee in Hanoi. Depart Vietnam.
itinerary.notes: Network with other travelers at hostels for tips and shared tours.
